intro: Thlaspi lereschii, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada cabbagewort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many species with mustard-like characteristics. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually fleshy and lobed. Thlaspi lereschii is adapted to cold climates and is often found at high elevations.
